metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1959 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
lib/x509/verify.c in GnuTLS before 3.1.21 and 3.2.x before 3.2.11 treats version 1 X.509 certificates as intermediate CAs, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended restrictions by leveraging a X.509 V1 certificate from a trusted CA to issue new certificates.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
guile-gnutls - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls30 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.11-2ubuntu1').
